item.title: Report E-2024080725
item.description:
Report E-2024080725

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024080049
item.description:
Report I-2024080049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: HATTIESBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 45000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver failed to slow down for a clover leaf curve resulting in the unit rolling over onto the driver side. Single vehicle crash. During the roll over event, dirt built up inside the crash box, breaking the piping from the crows foot. Product start escaping the tank through the broken pipe inside the crash box due to the way the unit came to rest.
